greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of positive integers obtained by swapping n-th natural number with the (n-g)-th sequentially, where g=prime(n+1)-prime(n)-1.
comment: By numerical explorations up to 50k terms, it seems to be an "infinite braid", i.e. it consists of a single infinite cycle, without any fixed points or closed cycles.
link: Ferenc Adorjan, Table of n,a(n) for n=1..10000
program: (PARI) {pperm(n)= /* Returns a vector with n terms of the sequence */
results.author: Ferenc Adorjan (fadorjan(AT)freemail.hu or ferencadorjan(AT)gmail.com), Mar 24 2007
